Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed with wide band in added white and rising rays in white outline with added red centres; exterior reserved with three bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos identifies the sherd as a Chalice Style phiale mesomphalos, but the curvature of the sherd and its thickness are not consistent with phialai. She also lists this sherd twice (no. 1074, no. 1109) in her catalogue. Both numbers are listed under the Chalice Style. The sherd was burnt during the bombings in London in 194
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 92)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 301, no. 1074, pl. 149, p. 302, no. 1109)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1639) (phase 2)
